isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS AND ACCESSORIES - Using Master Diagnostics (MD 32) - Programmable Parameters, Change/View

svcproc.title: Programmable Parameters, Change/View

step1.para: Select Vehicle, then Program, from the drop-down menu bar. A generic Vehicle Programming window will appear.
Add programmable parameters to this window by selecting Edit from the drop down menu bar and then Add/Delete/Edit Parameters.
Double clicking on a parameter from the Selected Parameters list box will remove it from the Vehicle Programming view window.
Placing the mouse pointer within the Vehicle Programming window and right clicking will bring up the advanced features.
Click the advanced features Refresh option.
The current value information being supplied by the ECM will be displayed to the desired parameters. A password must be entered to modify any parameters.

Placing the mouse pointer within the Vehicle Programming window and right clicking will bring up the advanced features. Click on the Enter Password option. This allows a password to be entered and retained for use. The password must be between 4 and 8 alphanumeric characters.

svcproc.para: The following screens illustrate the two Edit Parameter displays that normally appear after right clicking on the desired parameter. They differ on what can be changed. All parameters that can be toggled ON / OFF or changed within a numerical range will display - The parameter was programmed successfully - after clicking OK.
This is an example of a parameter value that can only be turned ON or OFF. After a selection, click OK.
For those parameters that require numeric entries, enter the appropriate value in the New Value box . The value must be within the required range. Click OK when complete.

Depending on the application, some parameters such as Coolant Temperature Compensation (CTC) and Derate Factor can not be changed. These are read only parameters and provide no means for modification.

step1.para: To verify that the parameter was changed, right click to bring up the advanced features. Click the Refresh option. MD will request all the programmable parameter information from the ECM.
